thread.section_title: The Wall Street Journal & Breaking News, Business, Financial and Economic News, World News and Video
thread.title: Republicans Pin Midterm Hopes on Tax Cuts

author: Siobhan Hughes
title: Republicans Pin Midterm Hopes on Tax Cuts
text:
WHITE SULPHUR SPRINGS, W. VA.—Republicans are planning to weather what is expected to be a difficult midterm election season by emphasizing the one thing on which they can all agree—last year’s sweeping, $1.5 trillion tax cuts.
At the Greenbrier Hotel in the Appalachian Mountains, Republicans cheered private polling data shared at a closed-door meeting showing that GOP favorability ratings had jumped a month after the tax law went into effect.
... RELATED VIDEO Just How Strong Is the Economy Heading Into Midterm Elections? President Trump boasted about the economic growth in his first year in office during his State of the Union speech this week. WSJ's Gerald F. Seib examines just how strong the economy really is heading into the midterm elections. Photo: Getty
